comments.description: Determines whether or not the Application Update Service automatically downloads and installs updates. This corresponds to whether or not the user has selected "Automatically install updates" in about:preferences. On Windows, this setting is shared across all profiles for the installation and is read asynchronously from the file. On other operating systems, this setting is stored in a pref and is thus a per-profile setting.

tags.name: A
tags.description: Promise that resolves with a boolean.

source.source: * @return A Promise that resolves with a boolean.

tokens.name: A
tokens.description: Promise that resolves with a boolean.

comments.description: Toggles whether the Update Service automatically downloads and installs updates. This effectively selects between the "Automatically install updates" and "Check for updates but let you choose to install them" options in about:preferences. On Windows, this setting is shared across all profiles for the installation and is written asynchronously to the file. On other operating systems, this setting is stored in a pref and is thus a per-profile setting. If this method is called when the setting is locked, the returned promise will reject. The lock status can be determined with UpdateUtils.appUpdateAutoSettingIsLocked()

tags.name: enabled
tags.description: If set to true, automatic download and installation of updates will be enabled. If set to false, this will be disabled.

tokens.name: enabled

source.source: *                 updates will be enabled. If set to false, this will be

tokens.description: updates will be enabled. If set to false, this will be

source.source: *                 disabled.

tokens.description: disabled.

tags.name: A
tags.description: Promise that, once the setting has been saved, resolves with the boolean value that was saved. If the setting could not be successfully saved, the Promise will reject. On Windows, where this setting is stored in a file, this Promise may reject with an I/O error. On other operating systems, this promise should not reject as this operation simply sets a pref.

comments.description: We want the preference definitions to be part of UpdateUtils for a couple of reasons. It's a clean way for consumers to look up things like observer topic names. It also allows us to manipulate the supported prefs during testing. However, we want to use values out of UpdateUtils (like pref types) to construct this object. Therefore, this will initially be a placeholder, which we will properly define after the UpdateUtils object definition.

comments.description: This function initializes per-installation prefs. Note that it does not need to be called manually; it is already called within the file. This function is called on startup, so it does not read or write to disk.

comments.description: Reads an installation-specific configuration setting from the update config JSON file. This function is guaranteed not to throw. If there are problems reading the file, the default value will be returned so that update can proceed. This is particularly important since the configuration file is writable by anyone and we don't want an unprivileged user to be able to break update for other users. If relevant policies are active, this function will read the policy value rather than the stored value.

tags.name: prefName
tags.description: The preference to read. Must be a key of the PER_INSTALLATION_PREFS object.

source.source: * @param  prefName
*           The preference to read. Must be a key of the

tokens.description: The preference to read. Must be a key of the

source.source: *           PER_INSTALLATION_PREFS object.

tokens.description: PER_INSTALLATION_PREFS object.

tags.name: A
tags.description: Promise that resolves with the pref's value.

source.source: * @return A Promise that resolves with the pref's value.

tokens.name: A
tokens.description: Promise that resolves with the pref's value.

comments.description: Changes an installation-specific configuration setting by writing it to the update config JSON file. If this method is called on a prefName that is locked, the returned promise will reject. The lock status can be determined with appUpdateSettingIsLocked().

tags.name: prefName
tags.description: The preference to change. This must be a key of the PER_INSTALLATION_PREFS object.

source.source: * @param  prefName
*           The preference to change. This must be a key of the

tokens.description: The preference to change. This must be a key of the

source.source: *           PER_INSTALLATION_PREFS object.

tokens.description: PER_INSTALLATION_PREFS object.

tags.name: value
tags.description: The value to be written. Its type must match PER_INSTALLATION_PREFS[prefName].type

source.source: * @param  value
*           The value to be written. Its type must match

tokens.description: The value to be written. Its type must match

source.source: *           PER_INSTALLATION_PREFS[prefName].type

tokens.description: PER_INSTALLATION_PREFS[prefName].type

tags.name: options
tags.description: Optional. An object containing any of the following keys: setDefaultOnly If set to true, the default branch value will be set rather than user value. If a user value is set for this pref, this will have no effect on the pref's effective value. NOTE - The behavior of the default pref branch currently differs depending on whether the current platform supports per-installation prefs. If they are supported, default branch values persist across Firefox sessions. If they aren't supported, default branch values reset when Firefox shuts down.
